references: We evaluate SEED-LLaMA on a wide range of multimodal comprehension tasks including image captioning and image/video question answering. Details of these benchmarks and evaluation metrics are provided in Appendix.                     D                   . As shown in Tab.                     3                   , our SEED-LLaMA achieves competitive performance in both the image and video understanding tasks compared with MLLMs that use continuous visual representations. The results demonstrate that our SEED tokenizer can generate discrete visual codes with high-level semantics, which facilities the visual comprehension. We can observe that pretraining from a LLM with larger model size improves performance on SEED-Bench and instruction tuning further contributes to enhanced results. Note that as pointed out by recent work             [               43              ,               44              ]            , previous VQA benchmarks listed in Tab.                     3                   are not tailored for evaluating MLLMs with open-from output, since they require an exact match between the model prediction and the target word or phrase.The qualitative examples of multimodal comprehension is provided in Appendix.                     E                   .

id_table_7.caption: Description of datasets in the instruction tuning of SEED-LLaMA.
table: Task Dataset Name Dataset Description Type Text-to-Image Generation JourneyDB [ 48 ] It contains 4429K Midjourney images, with text prompt, image caption, and QA pairs. Single-turn DiffusionDB [ 49 ] It contains 14 million images generated by Stable Diffusion using prompts by real users. Single-turn LAION-Aesthetics It contains several collections of subsets from LAION 5B with high visual quality. Single-turn VIST [ 50 ] It contains photos in 20K sequences, aligned to both caption and story language. Multi-turn Multimodal Prompt Image Generation Instructpix2pix [ 51 ] It contains text editing instructions and the corresponding images, with 454K samples. Single-turn MagicBrush [ 47 ] It contains 10K manually annotated triplets (source image, instruction, target image). Single-turn Image Conversation LLaVA [ 18 ] We use 58K multi-turn conversations between an assistant and a person. Multi-turn SVIT [ 52 ] It contains conversations, complex reasoning, referring QA and detailed image description. Multi-turn LLaVAR [ 53 ] It contains 16K multi-turn conversations, each with QA pairs for text-rich images. Multi-turn Multi-Image Understanding GSD [ 54 ] It contains 141K pairs of images with text describing the differences. Single-turn Image Captioning VSR [ 55 ] It contains texts describing the spatial relations in the image, with 7K training samples. Single-turn COCO Caption [ 31 ] It contains image-text pairs with human-written captions, with 82K training samples. Single-turn TextCaps [ 56 ] It requires the model to comprehend and reason the text in images, with 21K training samples. Single-turn Image QA VQAv2 [ 57 ] A dataset for open-ended image question answering, with 82K training samples. Single-turn OKVQA [ 58 ] It contains questions that require outside knowledge to answer, with 9K training samples. Single-turn A-OKVQA [ 59 ] It is a successor of OKVQA containing more challenging questions, with 17K training samples. Single-turn GQA [ 60 ] It contains questions for image understanding and reasoning, with 30K training samples. Single-turn VizWiz [ 61 ] It contains visual questions asked by people who are blind, with 20K training samples. Single-turn TextVQA [ 62 ] It contains questions that require models to read text in the image, with 800K training samples. Single-turn OCR-VQA [ 63 ] It contains questions that requires reasoning about text to answer, with 173K training samples. Single-turn Video Conversation Video-ChatGPT [ 64 ] It contains of 100K video-instruction pairs via manual and semi-automated pipeline. Single-turn Video QA ActivityNet [ 65 ] It contains 200 different types of activities from YouTube, with 10K training videos. Single-turn Next-QA [ 66 ] It contains 52K QA pairs of videos grouped into causal, temporal and descriptive questions. Single-turn MSVD [ 67 ] It contains videos from YouTube with descriptions, containing 1.2K training samples. Single-turn MSR-VTT [ 68 ] It contains videos from YouTube with descriptions, containing 19K training samples. Single-turn iVQA [ 69 ] It is a video QA dataset with mitigated language biases, containing 6K training samples. Single-turn
references: We summarize the datasets and their prompts for supervised instruction tuning of SEED-LLaMA in Tab.               7             and Tab.               8             . Note that MagicBrush         [           47          ]        contains both the single-turn and multi-turn scenarios, and we only use the single-turn for multimodal prompt image generation.

id_table_9.caption: Summary of the evaluation benchmarks.
table: Dataset Task Split Metric Image COCO [ 35 ] Text-to-Image Generation Karpathy test CLIP score ( ↑ ↑ \uparrow ) Flickr30K [ 36 ] Text-to-Image Generation test CLIP score ( ↑ ↑ \uparrow ) COCO Caption [ 31 ] Scene Description test CIDEr ( ↑ ↑ \uparrow ) VQAv2 [ 57 ] Scene Understanding QA test-dev VQA acc. ( ↑ ↑ \uparrow ) OKVQA [ 58 ] External Knowledge QA val VQA acc. ( ↑ ↑ \uparrow ) VizWiz [ 61 ] Scene Understanding QA test-dev VQA acc. ( ↑ ↑ \uparrow ) SEED-Bench [ 44 ] Comprehensive QA dim 1-9 MCQ acc. ( ↑ ↑ \uparrow ) Video MSVDQA [ 67 ] Event Understanding QA test Top-1 acc. ( ↑ ↑ \uparrow ) MSRVTTQA [ 68 ] Event Understanding QA test Top-1 acc. ( ↑ ↑ \uparrow ) NExTQA [ 69 ] Temporal/Causal QA test WUPS ( ↑ ↑ \uparrow )
references: In order to assess the multimodal comprehension and image generation ability of SEED-LLaMA, we evaluate SEED-LLaMA on 10 benchmarks as shown in Tab.                  9                . For the evaluation of image generation, we adopt the CLIP-ViT-L/14 to calculate the CLIP score between the ground-truth image and the generated image. When evaluating SEED-Bench, we adhere to the official guidelines, selecting the option with the highest log likelihood as the response for each multi-choice question (MCQ). For the evaluation on video tasks, we uniformly sample 4 frames for MSVDQA and MSRVTTQA, and 8 frames for NExTQA. For the other tasks, we follow the evaluation procedures in prior works           [             11            ,             22            ]          and either submit the results to the official server (VQAv2, VizWiz) or assess them using the official code ourselves.
